definition: to accuse of misconduct (in official task)/to impeach
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
to impeach

sentences.english: HW1. The Illinois House impeaches Governor Rod Blagojevich.
sentences.chinese: 伊利诺亚州众议院弹劾了州长罗德。

sentences.english: The Senate shall have the sole Power to try all Impeachments.
sentences.chinese: 唯参议院具有审判一切弹劾案之权。

sentences.english: It takes a simple majority of representatives’ votes to impeach an official.
sentences.chinese: 弹劾案的通过只需要过半众议员投赞成票。

sentences.english: He believes it should be easier to sack judges.
sentences.chinese: 他认为应该能更容易地弹劾法官。

sentences.english: "Impeachment of the president is clearly the end goal for the left, " Mr. Hannity added.
sentences.chinese: “弹劾总统显然是左派的最终目标，”汉尼提还说。

sentences.english: If the House votes for impeachment, the case then goes to the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 弹劾案在众议院通过后即转交参议院审理。

sentences.english: In eight years, she battled impeachment attempts and attempts of a military takeover.
sentences.chinese: 八年来，她挫败了弹劾她以及军事接管的企图。

sentences.english: Eunuchs for impeachment after being exiled Shuofang.
sentences.chinese: 后因弹劾宦官，被流放朔方。

sentences.english: So what do you have to do to get impeached?
sentences.chinese: 那么，你有没有这样做，以获得弹劾？

sentences.english: Impeachment Trials The Senate shall have the sole power to try all impeachments .
sentences.chinese: 在开庭审理弹劾案时，参议员们均应宣誓或誓愿。

sentences.english: This is why impeachment is "off the table."
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么克林顿弹劾案是“小康之列。

sentences.english: In the case of an impeached president, the chief justice of the Supreme Court presides over the trial.
sentences.chinese: 如果弹劾对象为总统，则由最高法院首席大法官主审。

sentences.english: The House of Representatives shall choose their Speaker and other officers; and shall have the sole power of impeachment.
sentences.chinese: 众议院选举本院议长和其他官员，并独自拥有弹劾权。

sentences.english: Another, Shamsoddin Hosseini, the finance minister, narrowly survived a bid to have him impeached.
sentences.chinese: 另一位盟友，伊朗经济财政部长侯赛尼也险遭弹劾。

sentences.english: The President's impeachment process is once in a blue moon in the U. S. history.
sentences.chinese: 总统弹劾案在美国历史上是很少见的。

sentences.english: Following the trial, senators vote on the articles of impeachment.
sentences.chinese: 听证结束后，参议员们对弹劾条款进行投票。

definition: to accuse/to impeach/(in imperial China) to level charges against an official
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
imperial censor
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to imprison
(government) cabinet
North Korea-China
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
(of a court official) to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
political enemy/opponent
henchmen
court councilor
memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
Director of Board of Rites (Confucian)
